column8: Notes
Trio Cr. Conf. - Fire Break
200m u/s Cascade - Danny Lee's
Diversion - Hatchery Fence
Fannin?s Fan -  Washout Cr., Slide Hole - WSC Station
White R. ML Br. - Falls in Middle of Upper Canyon
Includes spot swim conducted in Dickson Falls pools.
Purpose of swim was evaluation of resident rainbow trout and utilization of newly created habitat.
Purpose of swim was to evaluate rainbow fry and parr abundance within the Lower Campbell River.
Spot swim of Bamfield Road bridge pool.
Purpose of swim was to look for Atlantic salmon juveniles and/or adults.  None were observed.
Includes spot swims of Robertson Creek and Stamp Lagoon near hatchery.
Purpose of swim was to look for Atlantic salmon juveniles and/or adults.  None were observed.
Purpose of swim was to look for Atlantic salmon juveniles and/or adults.  None were observed.
Survey conducted at discharge of 64.4 m3/s (normal summer low = 35 m3/s)
Resurvey of upper index section only (high flows on Aug. 4 necessitated second swim)
Survey conducted for juvenile steelhead and adult cutthroat
Survey conducted for juvenile steelhead and adult cutthroat
Includes 4.5 km section above Nahmint Lake which held 16 fish/km
Primary objective was to assess presence/absence of Atlantic salmon juveniles and adults
Resurvey of lower index section only (high flows on Aug. 5 necessitated second swim)
Primary objective was to assess presence/absence of Atlantic salmon juveniles and adults
Primary purpose of survey was to look for Atlantic salmon adults and/or juveniles.
Primary purpose of survey was to look for Atlantic salmon adults and/or juveniles.
Primary purpose of swim was to enumerate cutthroat trout.
Includes spot swims of two pools (200 m total length) upstream of Nahmint Lake which held 73 steelhead.
Primary purpose of swim was to enumerate cutthroat trout.
Estimate of steelhead holding in the upper (30) and lower (15) hatchery sites on the day of the upper river survey.
Survey to find Floy tagged fish from Cruickshank releases.
A total of 8 km was surveyed, including 1.6 km above a falls to confirm its status as a barrier.
Spot swim from Ash confluence to Money's Pool at the end of the Ash River survey.
Spot swim of Chipman confluence, pool immed. U.s, and of Chipman Bridge Pool.  2 of 6 fish were small, likely one year in salt.
End of Ash survey, from Ash confluence to Bear Creek.
End of Ash survey, from Ash confluence to Bear Creek.
End of Ash survey, from Ash confluence to Bear Creek.
Survey is part of Hydro WUP monitoring
Survey is part of Hydro WUP monitoring
End of Ash WUP survey, from Ash confluence to end of Money's Pool.
End of Ash WUP survey, from Ash confluence to end of Money's Pool.

Only upper section completed (lake outlet to bridge) due to manpower/funding shortage.  First year without dedicated stock assessment funding (from HCTF).  As a result, few swims were done, and most were mainly funded by MAFF re Atlantic presence/absence.
Swims conducted by Ecofish Research for BC Hydro WUP planning.
